title: Exotrail’s geostationary spacevan to launch on Ariane 6 in 2026
summary: BREMEN, Germany — Exotrail’s geostationary spacevan is set to ride aboard Ariane 6 in 2026, in a boost for European space mobility capabilities. Arianespace announced the contract for launch on […]

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch Starship Flight 6 test mission from Starbase in southern Texas
summary: The mission is likely to be the fourth and final Starship flight before the end of 2024. Liftoff from Pad 1 at Starbase at Boca Chica Beach, Texas, is set for 4 p.m. CST (5 p.m. EST, 2200 UTC).

title: Space for Shore: Sentinel-1 reveals Arctic glacier retreat
summary: As Arctic temperatures rise, marine-terminating glaciers—especially in places like Svalbard—are undergoing rapid retreat and intensified calving.

title: Mike Greenley, MDA Space – Commercial Space Transformers
summary: In this episode of Commercial Space Transformers SpaceNews Senior Staff Writer Jason Rainbow speaks with Mike Greenley, CEO, MDA Space.

title: NASA Engineer Carries Indigenous Roots into New Aviation Era
summary: Growing up outside of Philadelphia, Abigail Reigner spent most of her childhood miles away from where her family called home, and where there was little trace of her Native American tribe and culture. Belonging to the Comanche Nation that resides in Lawton, Oklahoma, Reigner’s parents made every effort to keep her connected to her Indigenous […]

title: Connecting the Dots | More data storage, more space AI

title: ESA awards funding to four European launch startups
summary: The European Space Agency is providing additional funding to four launch vehicle startups to help them with testing of their vehicles.
